canonical_explanation.text: Water is very important for all living things. We use water for drinking, cooking, bathing, washing, and watering plants. Water comes from different sources like taps, wells, rivers, and rain. We should not waste water and must save it. We should only drink clean water because dirty water can make us sick.
rules: Water is important for all living things.
We use water for drinking, cooking, bathing, and washing.
Water comes from taps, wells, rivers, and rain.
We should save water and not waste it.
Clean water is safe, dirty water makes us sick.

questions.question_text: What do we use water for?
questions.explanation_correct: We use water for many important things like drinking, cooking, bathing, and washing. Water is very important for our health and for keeping us clean.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We cannot play in water all the time. We also need to use water for other important things like drinking, cooking, and cleaning ourselves. Water is not just for playing, but for many daily activities that help us live and stay healthy.

questions.question_text: Which activity needs water?
questions.explanation_correct: Bathing needs water because we use water to clean our body. Water helps us get rid of dirt and germs on our skin.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Sleeping, reading, and singing do not need water. We use water for activities like bathing, cooking, and drinking to stay healthy. Bathing is the activity that needs water the most out of the given options.

questions.question_text: What do plants need to grow?
questions.explanation_correct: Plants need both water and sunlight to grow. Water helps plants absorb nutrients from the soil and make their food. Sunlight helps plants make their own food through a process called photosynthesis. So, plants need both water and sunlight to grow big and healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants do not only need sunlight to grow. They also need water to help them absorb nutrients from the soil and make their own food. Food alone is not enough for plants to grow. They also need water and sunlight, so option B is the correct answer.

questions.question_text: Where does water come from in our homes?
questions.explanation_correct: Water in our homes comes from taps. Taps are connected to a water supply system that brings clean water to our homes from lakes, rivers, or underground sources.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water does not come from trees, air, or the ground only in our homes. Trees and the air do not provide the water we use at home. The water we use at home mostly comes from a water supply system that brings water to our taps from lakes, rivers, or underground sources.

questions.question_text: Which is a source of water?
questions.explanation_correct: A tap is a source of water. Water comes out of taps in our homes, which we can use for drinking, cooking, and other things. Taps are one of the most common sources of water that we use every day.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A tree, a book, and a chair are not sources of water. They are things we can see, but they do not have water coming out of them like a tap does. Taps are special because they have water that we can use, while trees, books, and chairs do not have water.

questions.question_text: Water that falls from clouds is called ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The water that falls from clouds is called rain. Clouds are made up of tiny water droplets that come together and become too heavy to stay in the sky, so they fall down as rain.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The water that falls from clouds is not called wind, snow, or fog. Wind is the movement of air, snow is frozen water, and fog is a cloud close to the ground. The water that falls from clouds is called rain.

questions.question_text: A deep hole in the ground with water is called a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A deep hole in the ground with water is called a well. A well is where we can get water from the ground to use for drinking, cooking, and other needs.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A river is a large stream of water that flows naturally in a channel. A tap is a device that controls the flow of water from a pipe. A bucket is a container used to hold water. None of these options are a deep hole in the ground with water, which is the correct answer - a well.

questions.question_text: Flowing water is found in a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A river is a flowing body of water. Water flows through a river, unlike in a well, bucket, or tap where the water is still or comes out in a stream.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A river is a large, flowing body of water that moves across the land. The water in a river is always moving, unlike in a well, bucket, or tap where the water is still or comes out in a stream. That's why the correct answer is a river, not a well, bucket, or tap.

questions.question_text: Why should we save water?
questions.explanation_correct: We should save water because water is precious and we don't have unlimited water. Water is very important for all living things to survive, so we must use it carefully and not waste it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water is not important is wrong because we all need water to live. We also don't have too much water or don't need water, because water is essential for drinking, cooking, cleaning, and helping plants grow. The correct answer is that water is precious and limited, so we should save it and not waste it.

questions.question_text: How can we save water?

options.text: Turn off tap when not using

questions.explanation_correct: Turning off the tap when not using it is the best way to save water. This stops water from flowing out and being wasted when we don't need it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Keeping the tap running or taking very long baths will waste a lot of water. This is not good because water is a precious resource that we need to save and use carefully. The best way to save water is to turn off the tap when we are done using it.

questions.question_text: Which water is safe to drink?
questions.explanation_correct: Clean water is safe to drink because it is free from dirt, germs, and other things that can make you sick. Clean water looks clear and does not have any mud or other particles in it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dirty or muddy water is not safe to drink because it has a lot of germs and other things that can make you sick if you drink it. You should always drink clean water that looks clear and does not have any dirt or other particles in it.

questions.question_text: What happens if we drink dirty water?
questions.explanation_correct: If we drink dirty water, we can get sick. Dirty water has germs and bacteria that can make us ill, so we should only drink clean water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Drinking dirty water is not good for us. It can make us sick and feel very unwell. We should always drink clean water to stay healthy.

questions.question_text: You are thirsty. What will you do?
questions.explanation_correct: If you are thirsty, you should drink water. Water is the best thing to drink when you are thirsty because it helps your body and makes you feel better.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eating food or sleeping will not help you when you are thirsty. Playing is fun, but it won't help you get water. The best thing to do when you are thirsty is to drink water, because water is what your body needs to feel good again.

questions.question_text: Mother is cooking rice. What does she need?
questions.explanation_correct: To cook rice, Mother needs water. Water is used to make the rice soft and cooked. Without water, the rice will not cook properly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is B) Water. Mother needs water to cook the rice. Rice alone is not enough - she also needs water to make the rice soft and cooked. Just fire is also not enough, as water is an important ingredient to cook the rice.

questions.question_text: The tap is leaking water. What should you do?

options.text: Tell an adult to fix it

questions.explanation_correct: You should tell an adult to fix the leaking tap. Water is precious and we should not waste it. Leaking taps can make a lot of water get wasted, so it's important to fix them quickly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You should not ignore the leaking tap or play with the water. Wasting water is not good for the environment. The best thing to do is to tell an adult so they can come and fix the tap and stop the water from leaking.

questions.question_text: What will happen if plants don't get water?

options.text: They will dry up and die

questions.explanation_correct: If plants don't get water, they will dry up and die. Plants need water to live and grow. Without water, they cannot survive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option B is correct because plants need water to live. Without water, they will dry up and die. They cannot grow bigger, become more colorful, or stay the same without water. Plants must have water to stay healthy and alive.

questions.question_text: You see muddy water in a puddle. Should you drink it?
questions.explanation_correct: You should not drink the muddy water in the puddle. Dirty water like that can make you sick. We should only drink clean water that is safe to drink.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'No', you should not drink the muddy water in the puddle. Muddy water can have germs and dirt that can make you sick if you drink it. Clean water from a tap or bottle is the best and safest water to drink.

questions.question_text: While brushing teeth, you should ___.
questions.explanation_correct: You should turn off the tap while brushing your teeth. This helps save water, which is very important for all living things. Keeping the tap running while brushing wastes a lot of clean water, which we should not do.
questions.explanation_incorrect: You should not keep the tap running, use lots of water, or waste water while brushing your teeth. This is because it would waste a lot of clean water, which is very important for all living things. We should only use the water we need and turn off the tap when we are not using it.

questions.question_text: In summer, there is less rain. What happens to wells?
questions.explanation_correct: In summer, there is less rain. This means that not enough water is being added to the wells, so the wells may dry up and have less water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The wells may dry up in summer because there is less rain. This means that not enough new water is being added to the wells, so they start to run out of water. Options A and D are incorrect because in summer, with less rain, the wells would have less water, not more.

questions.question_text: Which of these needs water to live?
questions.explanation_correct: Fish need water to live because they live in water and breathe through their gills. All living things need water to survive, but fish cannot live without being in water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Chairs, books, and stones do not need water to live. They are not living things. Only living things like fish need water to live and grow.

questions.question_text: Your clothes are dirty. How will you clean them?
questions.explanation_correct: We use water and soap to clean our dirty clothes. Water helps remove the dirt and soap helps make the clothes clean again.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We cannot clean our clothes with air, fire, or by doing nothing. Air does not have any cleaning power, fire will damage the clothes, and doing nothing will not make the clothes clean. The best way to clean dirty clothes is by using water and soap.

questions.question_text: A pond is a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A pond is a still water body, which means the water in it does not move. It is different from a river, which is moving water. So, the correct answer is B) Still water body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options are not correct. A) Moving water is a river, not a pond. C) Water in a tap is not a water body. D) Rain water is not a water body, it is water that falls from the sky. A pond is a still water body, which means the water in it does not move.

questions.question_text: To make water safe to drink, we can ___.
questions.explanation_correct: To make water safe to drink, we should boil or filter it. Boiling or filtering the water helps remove any dirt or germs that could make us sick if we drink it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: We should not add mud or dirt to water to make it safe to drink. Putting dirt in water will actually make it dirty and unsafe to drink. The best way to make water safe is to boil or filter it to remove any germs or impurities.

questions.question_text: How can you save water while taking a bath?
questions.explanation_correct: Taking quick baths is the best way to save water. The longer you stay in the bath, the more water you use. Taking short baths uses less water, which helps us save this precious resource.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Taking very long baths uses a lot of water, which is not a good way to save it. Keeping the water running while bathing also uses a lot of water. Using a swimming pool is for swimming, not for bathing. The best way to save water is to take quick baths.

questions.question_text: Who needs water?
questions.explanation_correct: All living things, like humans, animals, and plants, need water to live. Water is very important for all living things to grow and stay healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While humans, animals, and plants all need water, the correct answer is that all living things need water. This includes not just humans and animals, but also plants and other living organisms like bacteria. Water is essential for all living things to survive and thrive.

questions.question_text: We should not throw garbage in ___.
questions.explanation_correct: We should not throw garbage in water because water is very important for all living things. Throwing garbage in water can make the water dirty and unsafe to use, which can make us sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B) Water. We should never throw garbage in water like rivers, lakes, or oceans. Throwing garbage in water can pollute the water and make it dirty, which is not good for plants, animals, and people who use that water. Instead, we should always throw our garbage in the dustbin, garbage bag, or trash can.

questions.question_text: Where does rain water come from?
questions.explanation_correct: Rain water comes from clouds. Water from the ground, rivers, and lakes evaporates and goes up into the sky to form clouds. When the clouds get too heavy, the water falls back down as rain.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rain water does not come from the ground, trees, or taps. It comes from the clouds in the sky. The water in the clouds forms when water from the earth's surface, like rivers and lakes, evaporates and goes up into the air. When the clouds get too heavy, the water falls back down as rain.

questions.question_text: What do animals drink?
questions.explanation_correct: Animals drink water because they need it to live and grow. Water is very important for all living things, including animals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Animals do not drink oil or milk only. They drink water because water is the most important thing they need to survive. Oil and milk are not the main things that animals drink.

questions.question_text: Water is ___.
questions.explanation_correct: Water is precious because all living things need water to survive. We use water for many important things like drinking, cooking, and watering plants. Without water, we would not be able to live.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water is not something that we do not need. In fact, water is very important for all living things. We need water to drink, cook, bathe, and water our plants. Water comes from different sources like taps, wells, rivers, and rain, so it is not unlimited or useless. We should always try to save water and only drink clean water to stay healthy.

questions.question_text: Dirty water has ___.
questions.explanation_correct: Dirty water has germs, which are tiny living things that can make us sick. That's why it's important to drink only clean water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dirty water doesn't have nothing, vitamins, or good things. It has germs, which are tiny living things that can make us sick if we drink it. That's why we should always drink clean water.

questions.question_text: We need water to drink.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we need water to drink because our body needs water to stay healthy. Water helps our body to work properly and gives us energy to play and learn.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, we do not need water to drink. That is not true. All living things, including us, need water to stay alive and healthy. We need to drink water every day to keep our body working well.

questions.question_text: Plants do not need water.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants need water to grow and stay healthy. They use water to make their own food and stay alive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is not correct. Plants need water to live and grow. They use water to make their own food and stay healthy. Without water, plants will become dry and die.

questions.question_text: Rain is a source of water.
questions.explanation_correct: Rain is a source of water because it comes from the clouds in the sky. When water from the sea and lakes evaporates, it forms clouds. The clouds then drop the water back down as rain, which we can use.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rain is not an incorrect source of water. Rain is one of the many ways we get water. Water also comes from taps, wells, and rivers. But rain is definitely a very important source of water that we use every day.

questions.question_text: We should waste water.
questions.explanation_correct: We should not waste water because water is very important for all living things. We need to save water and use it wisely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water is a very precious resource, and we should not waste it. We use water for many important things like drinking, cooking, and watering plants. If we waste water, we may not have enough for these important uses.

questions.question_text: We should save water.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, we should save water because water is very important for all living things. We use water for many things like drinking, cooking, and watering plants. If we save water, we will have enough water for everyone to use.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, that is not correct. We should save water because water is important for us and all living things. If we waste water, we may not have enough water to use. We should be careful with water and not let it go to waste.

questions.question_text: Dirty water can make us sick.
questions.explanation_correct: Dirty water can make us sick because it has germs and bacteria that can make us ill. We should always drink clean water to stay healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dirty water cannot make us sick. Water is always safe to drink, no matter how it looks. We can drink any kind of water without worrying about getting sick.

questions.question_text: Muddy water is safe to drink.
questions.explanation_correct: Muddy water is not safe to drink because it has a lot of dirt and germs in it. Drinking dirty water can make you very sick.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Muddy water is not safe to drink. The water has a lot of dirt and germs in it, which can make you sick if you drink it. You should only drink clean water that is safe for drinking.

questions.question_text: Water in a river flows.
questions.explanation_correct: Water in a river flows because rivers are moving bodies of water. The water in a river keeps flowing and moving, usually from higher to lower ground.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Water in a river does not stay still. It keeps moving and flowing, usually from higher ground to lower ground. This is why the statement 'Water in a river flows' is true. If the water in a river did not flow, it would become dirty and stagnant.

questions.question_text: Turning off the tap saves water.
questions.explanation_correct: When you turn off the tap, no more water flows out. This saves the water that would have been wasted if the tap was left running.
questions.explanation_incorrect: If you leave the tap running, the water keeps flowing out and gets wasted. Turning off the tap stops the flow of water, so it saves water that would have been wasted.

questions.question_text: Animals also need water.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, animals also need water. All living things, including animals, need water to live and grow. Animals drink water and use it for many things like keeping their bodies healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: No, animals do not need water. This is not correct because all living things, including animals, need water to survive. Animals drink water and use it for many important things in their bodies.

questions.question_text: We use water for ___.
questions.explanation_correct: We use water for drinking because our body needs water to stay healthy. Water helps our body to work properly and give us energy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'drinking'. We use water for many things like cooking, bathing, and watering plants, but the most important use of water is for drinking. Our body needs water to function well and stay strong.

questions.question_text: We use water for ___ and washing.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is 'bathing' because we use water for cleaning and taking baths. Bathing is an important way we use water to keep our bodies clean and healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'bathing'. We use water for many things like drinking, cooking, and watering plants. But one of the main ways we use water is for bathing, which means taking a bath to clean our bodies. The question asks specifically about using water for bathing and washing, so the right answer is 'bathing'.

questions.question_text: Water from clouds is called ___.
questions.explanation_correct: Water from clouds is called rain. When water from the earth evaporates and rises up, it forms clouds. When the water in the clouds becomes heavy, it falls down as rain.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The water from clouds is not called 'tap' or 'well'. The water that comes out of taps and wells is water that has been collected from other sources like rivers, lakes, or underground. But the water that falls down from clouds is called rain.

questions.question_text: A deep hole with water is called a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A deep hole with water in the ground is called a well. Wells are a common source of water that many people use for drinking, cooking, and other purposes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'well'. A well is a deep hole dug in the ground to reach water. Water from the well can be used for many things, like drinking, cooking, and watering plants. The other options like 'river' or 'pond' are not correct because they are not deep holes with water.

questions.question_text: Flowing water is found in a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The answer is river because rivers are flowing bodies of water that you can see in many places. Water flows through rivers and goes from one place to another.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is not a tap, well, or rain. Taps and wells have still water, and rain falls from the sky. But rivers have water that is constantly moving and flowing from one place to another. The correct answer is river.

questions.question_text: We should ___ water.
questions.explanation_correct: We should save water because water is very important for all living things. We use water for many important things like drinking, cooking, and watering plants. If we waste water, there may not be enough water for everyone to use.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'save'. We should not waste water or let it go to waste. We should try to save as much water as we can so that everyone can have enough water to use. Water is very important and we need to make sure we don't use too much of it.

questions.question_text: ___ water is safe to drink.
questions.explanation_correct: Clean water is safe to drink because it does not have any dirt or germs in it. Clean water will not make you sick if you drink it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dirty water is not safe to drink. Dirty water can have germs and dirt in it, which can make you sick if you drink it. You should only drink clean water that comes from the tap, a well, or has been cleaned.

questions.question_text: ___ water makes us sick.
questions.explanation_correct: Dirty water can make us sick because it has germs and bacteria that can make us ill. We should only drink clean, safe water to stay healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer is 'Dirty' because dirty water can have many germs and bacteria that can make us sick. We should always drink clean water that is safe for our health. Drinking dirty water is not a good idea and can make us feel very unwell.

questions.question_text: All ___ things need water.
questions.explanation_correct: All living things need water because water is very important for them to survive. Living things like plants, animals, and humans need water to grow, stay healthy, and do all their activities.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'living'. This is because only living things like plants, animals, and humans need water to live. Things that are not alive, like rocks and toys, do not need water to survive. So the blank should be filled with the word 'living'.

questions.question_text: Turn off the ___ when not using water.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is 'tap' because the tap is the part of the water system that we turn on and off to use water. When we are not using water, we should turn off the tap to save water and not waste it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer is not 'faucet' or 'sink'. The tap is the part that we use to control the flow of water. We should turn off the tap when we are not using water so that we don't waste it. Leaving the tap running when not in use can cause a lot of water to be wasted.

questions.question_text: In our home, water comes from a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: The water in our home comes from a tap because that's where the water pipes from the city or town's water supply connect to our house. Taps make it easy for us to get water whenever we need it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The water in our home does not come from a well or a river. It comes from the city or town's water supply, which is connected to our house through pipes. The water then comes out of the tap whenever we need it.

questions.question_text: Plants need ___ to grow.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants need water to grow because water helps them make their own food and become strong and healthy. Water is very important for plants to live and thrive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'water'. Plants need water to grow, not other things like air or soil. Water helps plants make their own food and become big and strong. If you write anything else, like 'sun' or 'air', that would be incorrect because plants need water the most to grow.

questions.question_text: Put in order: How rain water reaches us.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Clouds form, Rain falls, We collect water. This is because first the clouds form in the sky, then the rain falls down from the clouds, and finally we collect the rain water in buckets, tanks, or other containers.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Rain falls, Clouds form, We collect water. This is not correct because the clouds must form first before the rain can fall. After the rain falls, then we can collect the water in buckets, tanks, or other containers.

questions.question_text: Put in order: How to save water while brushing.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is turn on the tap, brush your teeth, then turn off the tap. This saves water because you only turn the tap on when you need it to brush your teeth, and then turn it off right away when you are done. This way, you don't waste any water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be to turn off the tap before brushing your teeth. This is wrong because you need the water running to brush your teeth properly. You should always turn on the tap first, then brush your teeth, and then turn off the tap when you are done. This saves the most amount of water.

questions.question_text: Put in order: Watering a plant.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is 'Get water, Pour on plant, Plant grows' because the plant needs water to grow and be healthy. First, you need to get the water, then pour it on the plant, and after that, the plant will grow and become stronger.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be 'Pour on plant, Get water, Plant grows'. This is wrong because you need to get the water first before you can pour it on the plant. If you pour the water on the plant without getting it first, the plant will not be able to grow. The correct order is 'Get water, Pour on plant, Plant grows'.

questions.question_text: Put in order: Making water safe to drink.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is 'Get water, Boil or filter, Drink safely' because we need to first get the water, then make it safe to drink by boiling or filtering it, and finally we can drink the clean, safe water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be 'Drink safely, Get water, Boil or filter'. This is wrong because we cannot drink the water safely until we have first gotten the water and then boiled or filtered it to make it clean and safe to drink.

questions.question_text: Put in order: Getting water from a well.
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Drop bucket, Pull up bucket, Get water. This is the right way to get water from a well because you first need to drop the bucket down into the well, then pull it back up to get the water, and finally you can use the water you got from the well.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: Get water, Drop bucket, Pull up bucket. This is wrong because you cannot get the water first before dropping the bucket down into the well and then pulling it back up. You need to drop the bucket, pull it up, and then you can get the water from the well.
